title.narrative: Avian and Human Influenza Control and Preparedness Emergency Project

description.narrative: The Project's overall development objective is to support the implementation of the Cambodia Comprehensive AHI National Plan contributing to minimize the threat posed to humans and the poultry sector by AHI infection in Cambodia, and to prepare for, control, and respond if necessary to a human influenza pandemic.

condition.narrative: Annual Audit Reports, prepared by independent auditors, should be submitted to the Bank not later than June 30 every year.
Annual physical progress reports and financial statements for each preceding calendar year will be presented for discussion withIDA.
Annual work plans (with budgets) for each calendar year, will be presented not later than September 30th of the previous year fordiscussion with IDA.
Environmental Management Plan (EMP) and Ethnic Minorities Planning Framework (EMPF) are both satisfactory to IDA, are approved byRecipient and properly disclosed in country.
MAFF and NCDM will establish complete financial management systems acceptable to IDA, including the establishment of computerizedaccounting software.
Mid-Term Progress and Assessment Report will be presented by NCDM, in collaboration with the IA, for discussion with IDA, at theend of the second year of implementation.
The Project Implementation Plan, satisfactory to IDA, has been prepared by NCDM in coordination with the IAs, incl. arrangementsfor implementation, procurement, accounting, and FM.

title.narrative: (ii) Percentage of investigated cases from which samples were collected.

comment.narrative: 142 cases were typical of AI and had samples collected out of 174 investigated in 2013.

title.narrative: (i) Percentage of suspect cases investigated and time from report to investigation.

baseline.value: Low number of investigation with longer period.

comment.narrative: Exceeded the target

actual.value: 439 or 96% (24 hours) of all reported cases of project period.

comment.narrative: 439 (96%) out of 465 suspected HPAI cases were investigated within 24 hours.

title.narrative: (iii) Percentage of cases from which testing for Avian Influenza and Newcastle Disease are done.

comment.narrative: All samples collected were transported and tested in NaVRI.

title.narrative: b.5. Percent of targeted hospital staff trained for infection control and case management.

comment.narrative: HSSP2 program database. Semi-annual reported by HSSP2 in 2012
Component moved to HSSP2, but the ICR will be measured till June 30, 2013.
Achieved.

title.narrative: b.2. Percentage of VHV trained in AI monitoring, reporting and control measures.

comment.narrative: HSSP2 program database. Semiannual reported by HSSP2
Component moved to HSSP2. The ICR will be assessed only up to August 3, 2012.
There are about 9,000 VHVs in the country. WHO has been contracted to train them.

title.narrative: Evidence of improved effectiveness of participating animal and human health services in responding to the risk of avian influenza in poultry and a human pandemic of influenza.

baseline.value: Low effectiveness of response preparation for identified risks.

comment.narrative: Through data on reporting of and response to disease outbreaks, field studies on farms and villages before and afterimplementationof preventive measures (earlier access to treatment would be a useful way of measuring this for all suspect cases).
Improved effectiveness is measured by the speed of response to reportedoutbreaks in poultry and humans by both animal and humanhealth response teams.

title.narrative: a.1. Animal Health: Number of new VAHWs trained using the revised curriculum and percentage of these providing disease reports at commune meetings.

baseline.value: # New VAHWs being trained using revised curriculum.

target.value: 750 trained, and 80% of trainees providing disease reports.

comment.narrative: Exceeded the target

actual.value: 2,122 new VAHW were trained with 83% of trainees providing disease reports.

comment.narrative: 2122 new VAHW were trained, of which 83% provided disease reports. Refresher courses also provided to 3230 VAHW on avian and humaninfluenza. New training materials printed. Kits containing basic equipment for VAHWs provided to all those trained and certified.

title.narrative: b.7. Pandemic preparedness plan developed and desk-top exercise implemented.

comment.narrative: Achieved. A rapid containment plan was also developed but will no longer be tested through a desk-top exercise (consistent withthe recent shift of global health emphasis and WHO technical advice).

title.narrative: b.1. Human Health: Percentage of provincial and district rapid response teams trained.

comment.narrative: Exceeded as of this date. Refresher training courses also provided to all members of the Rapid Response Teams.

title.narrative: b.4. Percentage of sentinel sites that generate ILI surveillance reports on time.

comment.narrative: Exceeded. MOH extended the ILI sites from 6 to 10 and also conducted Severe Acute Respiratory Infection detection at 4 sites tocomplement the ILI surveillance to get the most accurate data for seasonal influenza and new strains of pandemic influenza.

title.narrative: No case of H5N1 HPAI in periurban commercial poultry flocks once control and preventive measures are implemented.

target.value: Downward trend with almost zero number of cases.

comment.narrative: This indicator is irrelevant as all cases were in rural areas.

title.narrative: a.4. Percentage of farms or markets on which recommended risk mitigation measures to prevent AI is fully implemented.

baseline.value: Limited number of farms provided recommendations.

comment.narrative: Exceeded the target
85% of farms provided with recommendations had adopted the measures. 648 farmers and 211 traders trained in basic bio-securitymeasures.

title.narrative: a.2. Number of reports of suspected HPAI from VAHWs.

comment.narrative: Exceeded the target
180 suspected cases were reported during the project implementation period. 174 of suspected HPAI cases were investigated within24hours.

title.narrative: b.6. Percentage of suspected patients treated according to infection control and case management guideline.

comment.narrative: This target to 100% in May 2011.
Exceeded original target based on self-reported data. As per the joint press release of MoH and WHO on 56th H5N1 cases).

title.narrative: b.3. Percentage of warning signals detection of cluster of patients with clinical symptoms of influenza, closely related in time and place followed by field investigation within 24 hours.

comment.narrative: Most of outbreak detections have been made from indicator based and event based surveillance, sentinel surveillance and zoonosissurveillance.

title.narrative: a.3. Target for training in emergency vaccination met and government advised for findings.

comment.narrative: An additional 90 vets were trained under Healthy Livestock Healthy Village, Better Life program.

title.narrative: c.3. NCDM emergency MIS and M&E systems designed, developed and established.

target.value: MIS and M&E systems designed, developed and established.

comment.narrative: Achieved. Emergency MIS and M&E systems designed, developed and established.
Achieved. PPRRP developed and tested in targeted high risk provinces.

title.narrative: c.1. Inter-ministerial Cooperation for Pandemic Preparedness: NCDM's TOR modified to include inter-ministerial cooperation for pandemic preparedness.

comment.narrative: Achieved (in Year 5 instead of Year 1 of the project).

title.narrative: Number of villages adopting two or more disease preventive measures recommended under the "Healthy Livestock, Healthy Village, Better Life" scheme.

comment.narrative: Accomplished.
In all 30 villages more than two measures were being implemented. 5885 households have benefited from this scheme.

title.narrative: Clients who have adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by the project

comment.narrative: 30 villages with 30 households adopting the measure per village.
1443.00 households have adopted improved poultry raising technologies promoted by the project.

title.narrative: Clients who adopted an improved agr. technology promoted by project – female

comment.narrative: Exceeded the target
4990 women have attended training and they are raising poultry in their backyards following the training advice.

title.narrative: Technologies demonstrated in the project areas (number)

comment.narrative: A technology package on the proper cleaning of villages, vaccination of poultry according to plan, and cage rearing of chicks hasbeen demonstrated in the project villages.
